titles.title: Tax Credit to Hire Veterans Act of 2011
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the limitation on expensing certain depreciable assets for certain businesses that hire veterans.
Tax Credit to Hire Veterans Act of 2011

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Tax Credit to Hire Veterans Act of 2011 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow through 2014 an increase in the amount of depreciable business assets that an eligible small business can expense (i.e., deduct in the same taxable year) if such business employs certain unemployed veterans. Defines "eligible small business" to mean a business entity whose gross receipts in the preceding taxable year did not exceed $5 million or that did not employ more than 500 full time employees.
